prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput'. Diagram: A scatter plot with many dots (50+). X-axis labeled 'tok/min/GPU', Y-axis labeled 'ms/token'. Trend is upward but noisy. Only text: 'Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput', 'tok/min/GPU', 'ms/token'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
Scatter plot has many points and a noisy upward trend.

failures: X-axis label includes an extra arrow symbol not specified in the prompt ('tok/min/GPU →' instead of exactly 'tok/min/GPU').
improvements: Remove the arrow glyph from the x-axis label so the only text there is exactly 'tok/min/GPU'.
Keep all other visual elements (scatter, trend bands, colors, title placement) as they are, since they match the requested style and content.
grade.summary: Visual style, title text, scatter plot density/trend, and axis naming are all correct, but the x-axis label contains an extra arrow character, violating the 'no extra text' requirement.
